info.author: Positive Technologies
info.description:
BVT-testing framework

Allows performing simple lightweght BVT testing for your project.


*Configuration file structure*

```yaml
# product component name
component:
    bvt:   # test group

        # working tests (checks)
        checks:
            - test_service # service status
            - test_required_file # the required file exists
            - test_version # an executable reports it's version in format <major>.<minor>.<revision>
            - test_config_options # config file option check, supported formats are: yaml, json, ptdpi-yaml (customied yaml with `include` directives which are omitted before testing)
            - test_dirs # check for required directories
            - test_http_response # validate a service provides 200-status code in response to specific http get request

        # options for tests listed above
        # each section is a yaml list object
        check_settings:

            test_http_response_200:
                - 'http://localhost/locales/l10n/dashboard/en-EN.json'

            test_dir_not_empty:
                - /opt/product/sdk/

            test_required_file:
                - /etc/nginx/sites-enabled/product.conf

            # config file param names are given in xpath-style with '-' as layer separator
            # if the param name contains '-' itself, it should be escaped by another '-'
            test_config_options:

                nginx:
                    path: '/etc/nginx/sites-enabled/product.conf'
                    type: nginx  # custom config file type
                    # parameter values to check
                    conf-server_1-listen: '443 ssl'
                    conf-server_2-listen: '80 default_server'
                    conf-server_2-return: '301 https://$host$request_uri'

                model-service-ng:
                    path: '/opt/product/etc/model-service-ng.conf'

                    global-data_dir: '/opt/product/data/'
                    global-install_dir: '/opt/product'
                    model--service--ng-primary_config-in_rmq-host: findall(localhost|127.0.0.1)

            test_version:
                - /opt/product/bin/mybinary
            test_service:
                cron: active
                networking.service: active
```

*Configuration file hierarchy*

Each component/service of your product can have its own test configuration file located in config/services.conf.d
directory. The structure of such test configuration file is given above. It can be used to run standalone component
BVT testing.

Next you can define config/meta.yaml test configuration file, which already allows performing product-level BVT testing.
All service test configuration files from services.conf.d are read and merged into this file before tests are actually launched.
Parameter values from meta.yaml overwrite the corresponding parameters for corresponding services from services.conf.d
configurations.
If service parameter value in meta.yaml is none - this parameter is deleted from service test configuration.
If service test configuration file lacks such parameter - it will be added.

Finally, you can define a release-specific (or brach-specific) test configuration in config/meta.conf.d directory.
Parameters from this file have the highest priority and overwrite all corresponding parameters from meta.yaml and service configs
after merging.


*Launching*

1. Running standalone component-tests

```bash
$ pytest /mnt/north_clover/src/tests -v --config-path=/mnt/north_clover/config --test-group=component-bvt
```
2. Running system-level tests

```bash
$ pytest /mnt/north_clover/src/tests -v --config-path=/mnt/north_clover/config --test-group=meta-master-bvt
```
`meta-master-bvt` here is the default value for `--test-group`, which corresponds to testing the master branch of the product
This implies config files merging process described in [Configuration file hierarchy] section.

3. Running brach-specific or release-specific test-configuration

```bash
$ pytest /mnt/north_clover/src/tests -v --config-path=/mnt/north_clover/config --test-group=meta-release_1-bvt
```
`meta-release_1-bvt` corresponds to testing the release_1 branch of the product
